cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 180 miles ESE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest across the Gulf of Mexico toward the central-south Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-central Louisiana coast (between Cameron and Morgan City)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None issued yet (watches expected Wednesday for portions of the northern Gulf Coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from upper Texas through Louisiana to western Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (34-63 kt) are increasingly likely; 61 % cumulative probability with a 26 % chance of 50-kt winds. Hurricane-force gusts cannot be ruled out.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm surge watches expected; current guidance suggests water rises above 3 ft possible along south-central Louisiana including the lower Mississippi River.
weather_observation.rainfall: Forecast 4â€“8 inches with isolated totals up to 12 inches, leading to flash, urban, and minor river flooding near the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Very rough seas on the Lower Mississippi River and adjacent sounds, possible navigation channel closures, and brief tornado threats in outer rainbands.
